channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Go urges GSIS to offer new loans
item.description: Sen. Bong Go has urged the Government Service Insurance System to establish loan and other relief programs with flexible payment terms that may help its members manage the financial and economic fallout of the pandemic.

item.title: Duterte asks China, Russia for vaccine loans
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: President Duterte will ask China and Russia if they can provide loans to the Philippines to enable the country to acquire the much-needed vaccines in the fight against the coronavirus disease 2019.

item.title: 3 Philippines companies land in Forbes list
item.author: Iris Gonzales
item.description: Three Philippine companies Asia United Bank, Crown Asia Chemicals Corp. and Vivant – made it to Forbes Asia’s 200 Best Under A Billion list.

item.title: RT-PCR test not required for workers
item.author: Louella Desiderio
item.description: Workers in the tourism, manufacturing and other sectors with high interaction and exposure to the public are not required to be tested for coronavirus disease 2019 or COVID-19, officials said yesterday

item.title: PhilHealth: P500 million paid to Red Cross
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: A total of P504.2 million has been paid to the Philippine Red Cross for swab tests conducted by the PRC as of Aug. 12, the Philippine Health Insurance Corp. announced yesterday.

item.title: Duque tagged as ‘godfather’ of PhilHealth ‘mafia’
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: Whistleblowers and senior officials at the Philippine Health Insurance Corp. have tagged Health Secretary Francisco Duque III as the “godfather” of the alleged mafia in the state firm engaged in pocketing billions of pesos through various corruption schemes.

item.title: Philippines temporarily bans Australian poultry imports amid bird flu
item.author: Louise Maureen Simeon
item.description: The Department of Agriculture has issued a temporary ban on the importation of domestic and wild birds and their byproducts from Australia, following an outbreak of avian virus in the country.

item.title: House body to summon over 40 hospitals
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: Owners or representatives of over 40 hospitals suspected of involvement in the P153-billion Philippine Health Insurance Corp. fund anomaly are expected to appear tomorrow before a House panel to air their side and shed light on the controversy.

item.title: ‘Virus mutation not yet significant’
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: The World Health Organization is monitoring the reported mutation of a variant of Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome-coronavirus-2 or SARS-CoV-2, which causes COVID-19.

item.title: Powerful quake rocks Masbate
item.author: Helen Flores
item.description: A magnitude 6.6 earthquake struck Masbate province and other areas in Bicol and the Visayas yesterday morning, killing a retired police officer while injuring 24 others, according to the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology.
